t: Isaiah 5
God’s Disappointing Vineyard
Now*pn let me sing to my Well-beloved A*ld song of my Beloved regarding His vineyard: My*ln Well-beloved has a vineyard On*ld a very fruitful hill.

He*ld dug it up and cleared out its stones, And*ld planted it with the choicest vine. He*ld built a tower in its midst, And*ld also made a winepress in it; So*ld He expected it*i to bring forth good*i grapes, But*ld it brought forth wild grapes.
“And*ln now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah, Judge,*ld please, between Me and My vineyard.
What*ld more could have been done to My vineyard That*ld I have not done in it? Why*ld then, when I expected it*i to bring forth good*i grapes, Did*ld it bring forth wild grapes?
And*ld now, please let Me tell you what I will do to My vineyard: I*ld will take away its hedge, and it shall be burned; And*ild break down its wall, and it shall be trampled down.
I*ld will lay it waste; It*ld shall not be pruned or dug, But*ld there shall come up briers and thorns. I*ld will also command the clouds That*ld they rain no rain on it.”

For*ln the vineyard of the Lord*s of hosts is*i the house of Israel, And*ld the men of Judah are His pleasant plant. He*ld looked for justice, but behold, oppression; For*ld righteousness, but behold, a cry for*i help.*i
Impending Judgment on Excesses
Woe*pn to those who join house to house; They*ld add field to field, Till*ld there*i is*i no place Where*ld they may dwell alone in the midst of the land!
In*ld my hearing the Lord*s of hosts said,*i “Truly,*ld many houses shall be desolate, Great*ld and beautiful ones, without inhabitant.
For*ld ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, And*ld a homer of seed shall yield one ephah.”
Woe*ln to those who rise early in the morning, That*ild they may follow intoxicating drink; Who*ld continue until night, till*i wine inflames them!
The*ld harp and the strings, The*ld tambourine and flute, And*ld wine are in their feasts; But*ld they do not regard the work of the Lord,*s Nor*ld consider the operation of His hands.
Therefore*ln my people have gone into captivity, Because*ld they*i have*i no knowledge; Their*ld honorable men are*i famished, And*ld their multitude dried up with thirst.
Therefore*ld Sheol has enlarged itself And*ld opened its mouth beyond measure; Their*ld glory and their multitude and their pomp, And*ld he who is jubilant, shall descend into it.
People*ld shall be brought down, Each*ld man shall be humbled, And*ld the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled.
But*ld the Lord*s of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, And*ld God who is holy shall be hallowed in righteousness.
Then*ld the lambs shall feed in their pasture, And*ld in the waste places of the fat ones strangers shall eat.
Woe*ln to those who draw iniquity with cords of vanity, And*ld sin as if with a cart rope;
That*ld say, “Let Him make speed and*i hasten His work, That*ld we may see it;*i And*ld let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come, That*ld we may know it.”*i
Woe*ln to those who call evil good, and good evil; Who*ld put darkness for light, and light for darkness; Who*ld put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!
Woe*ln to those*i who*i are*i wise in their own eyes, And*ld prudent in their own sight!
Woe*ln to men mighty at drinking wine, Woe*ld to men valiant for mixing intoxicating drink,
Who*ld justify the wicked for a bribe, And*ld take away justice from the righteous man!

Therefore,*ln as the fire devours the stubble, And*ld the flame consumes the chaff, So*ild their root will be as rottenness, And*ld their blossom will ascend like dust; Because*ld they have rejected the law of the Lord*s of hosts, And*ld despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

Therefore*ld the anger of the Lord*s is aroused against His people; He*ld has stretched out His hand against them And*ld stricken them, And*ld the hills trembled. Their*ld carcasses were*i as refuse in the midst of the streets. For*ln all this His anger is not turned away, But*ld His hand is*i stretched out still.
He*ln will lift up a banner to the nations from afar, And*ld will whistle to them from the end of the earth; Surely*ld they shall come with speed, swiftly.
No*ld one will be weary or stumble among them, No*ld one will slumber or sleep; Nor*ld will the belt on their loins be loosed, Nor*ld the strap of their sandals be broken;
Whose*ld arrows are*i sharp, And*ld all their bows bent; Their*ld horses’ hooves will seem like flint, And*ld their wheels like a whirlwind.
Their*ld roaring will*i be*i like a lion, They*ld will roar like young lions; Yes,*ld they will roar And*ld lay hold of the prey; They*ld will carry it*i away safely, And*ld no one will deliver.
In*ld that day they will roar against them Like*ld the roaring of the sea. And*ld if one*i looks to the land, Behold,*ld darkness and*i sorrow; And*ld the light is darkened by the clouds.
